intro: Kosteletzkya sagittata, commonly known as the arrowhead plant, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. It has a robust root system that helps stabilize soil and prevent erosion. Its adaptability to moist environments makes it a valuable plant for ecological restoration projects.
